div.l: And vp þei gone and down̄ a yene a none
Til þat þe Miller spurned at a stone
And downe he fell and bakward on his wife
Þat wist no þing of þis nyce strife
For she was fallyn in slepe a litul wight
With Iohn þe clerk þat waked al night
And with þe fal oute of her͗e slepe she braied
Help holi crosse of Brome holme she seid
In manꝰus tuas lorde qduod she to þe I call
A wake Symkyn̄ þe fende is on vs fall
Myn̄ hert is broken̄ help I am but dede
Ther͗e lieth vpon̄ my wombe and on my hede
Help Symkyn̄ for þe fals clerkes fuȝghtfugtfuȝht
Þis Iohn̄ stert vp as fast as euer he miȝt
And groped bi þe wall to and fro
To finde a staf and she stert vp also
And knew þe esters better þan did Iohn
And bi þe wal a staff she toke a non̄
And sagh a litul shymryng of a light
For at an hole yn shone þe mone light
And bi þat light she sagh þeim bothe two
But sekirly she wist not who was ho
And as she sagh a white Þyng in her͗e ey
And whan she gan þis white þing to aspiēn
She wende þe clerk had a voluper
And with þe staf she drew it ner͗e and ner͗e
And wende haue hit þis Alyn̄ atte full
And smote þe myller on þe pilled scull
That down̄ he goeth and cried harowe I dey
This clerk bet him wel and lete him lye
And araied hem and toke her͗e horse anone
And eke þeir͗e mele and on þeir͗e wey gone
And atte · Mill dore þei toke þeir͗e cake
Of half abusshell floure wel Ibake
And hath lost þe grynding of his whete
And paied for þe souꝑper eueri dele
Of Aleyn and Iohn and bete hīm well
His wife is swyued and his douter als
Lo swiche it is a Miller to be fals
And ther͗eto þis prouerbe is seid ful sothe Vix bene moritur
Him thar͗e not wene wele that euel dothe qui male vixerit
A gilour͗e shal him self begiled be
And god þat sitteth hie in his mageste
